title: 114_hr245
content: The text chunk "SECTION 1. CODIFICATION OF EFFECTIVE DATES FOR CLAIMS UNDER THE LAWS ADMINISTERED BY THE SECRETARY OF VETERANS AFFAIRS." has been condensed to focus on the key information about the effective dates for claims under the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. The definitions related to claims under the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs have been amended to include terms like claimant, claim, formal claim, and informal claim. The definitions related to claims under the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs have been amended to include terms like formal claim and informal claim, which specify the types of claim submissions accepted by the Secretary. The definitions related to claims under the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs have been amended to include terms like formal claim and informal claim, specifying the types of claim submissions accepted. The term 'reasonably raised claim' now refers to evidence of entitlement not explicitly raised in a claim but logically placed at issue upon review of the claim and record. The term 'reasonably raised claim' now refers to an entitlement to a benefit under VA laws that is not explicitly raised in a claim but logically placed at issue upon review of the claim and record. Section 5100 of the VA laws defines key terms related to claims processing. Informal claims must be followed up with a formal claim application. Requests for claim increases or reopening are treated the same as formal claims. Effective dates for applications are specified in Section 5110. Effective Dates for applications under Section 5110 of VA laws state that informal communications regarding benefits will be considered as filed on the date they are submitted, as long as a formal application is filed within 180 days of receiving necessary forms from the Secretary. Failure to do so within the specified timeframe will result in the application not being accepted. The Secretary will consider an application filed on the date the completed form is submitted if the necessary forms are received but not filed within 180 days. Additionally, the Secretary is required to address and adjudicate reasonably raised claims that arise during the process of addressing any claim. The Secretary is mandated to address and adjudicate reasonably raised claims that come up during the handling of any claim, including evidence related to separate conditions not previously identified. The amendments made by this Act regarding the treatment of reasonably raised claims will be effective on the enactment date and apply to claims submitted on or after that date.
